title: Code Coverage ‚òÇÔ∏è
ques: What metric measures the percentage of your source code that is executed when your test suite runs?
explanation: High code coverage suggests (but does not guarantee) that most of your application logic has been verified.

title: Statement Coverage üìù
ques: Which coverage metric ensures that every line of code (statement) has been executed at least once?
explanation: It's the most basic form of coverage.

title: Branch Coverage üåø
ques: If you have an `if(x > 0) else ...` block, which coverage metric ensures that both the `true` and `false` paths are tested?
explanation: Statement coverage might hit the line containing the `if`, but branch coverage checks all possible control flow paths.

title: 100% Coverage üíØ
ques: Does having 100% code coverage mean your application is bug-free?
explanation: Coverage only proves the code ran, not that the logic is correct or that edge cases (like null inputs) are handled properly.
